plugin.settings.title: Number of decimal digits (precision)
plugin.settings.description:
Round numbers to this number of significant digits MAXIMUM (will not force there to be digits if the digits are zeros). Set to 0 for no decimals ever (integers only). Note: You can always override this setting with the command:
/Calculate Math Blocks (no rounding)

plugin.settings.title: Preset Variables/Values
Format for Math Display in Popup Preview
plugin.settings.description:
Each line will be displayed in a single popup preview. Lines need to be short. Use a key name wrapped in double curly braces, e.g. ({{someThing}}) for key/values to substitute. Key options:
{{row}} - row number
{{originalText}} - line's text in the math block
{{value}} - value to display
{{expression}} - expression the computer constructed to evaluate (just for verification purposes)
{{typeOfResult}} - the type of this line (mostly for debugging)

plugin.settings.title: Format for Math Replacement in Document
plugin.settings.description:
After calculation, the math line will be written according to this format. Use a key name wrapped in double curly braces, e.g. ({{someThing}}) for key/values to substitute. Key options:
{{row}} - row number
{{originalText}} - line's text in the math block
{{value}} - value to display
{{expression}} - expression the computer constructed to evaluate (just for verification purposes)
{{typeOfResult}} - the type of this line (mostly for debugging)

plugin.settings.title: Format MathBlock Results into Columns
plugin.settings.description: If set to true, the plugin will line up all the calculations in columns in the Math Block (horizontal space permitting)

plugin.settings.NOTE: DO NOT CHANGE THE FOLLOWING SETTINGS; ADD YOUR SETTINGS ABOVE ^^^

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Math Solver commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs
